data.title: Retro@14th March
data.meta_description: In the Year 2017 today is  73 Day Remaining Days in 2017 are  292 EVENTS: 1878-Vernacular Press Act, 1878 a highly controversial measure repressing the freedom of vernacular press. The regime of viceroy Lord Lytton is particularly noted for his most controversial press policy which led to the enactment of the Vernacular Press Act on…
data.text:
In the Year 2017 today is 73 Day

Remaining Days in 2017 are 292

EVENTS:

1878-Vernacular Press Act, 1878 a highly controversial measure repressing the freedom of vernacular press.

The regime of viceroy Lord Lytton is particularly noted for his most controversial press policy which led to the enactment of the Vernacular Press Act on 14 March 1878. Earlier dramatic performances act (1876) was enacted to repress the writing and staging of the allegedly seditious dramas. Vernacular Press Act (1878) was aimed at repressing seditious propaganda through vernacular newspapers. Introducing the Bill the Law Member of the Council narrated how the vernacular newspapers and periodicals were spreading seditious propaganda against the government. The viceroy Lord Lytton strongly denounced newspapers published in the vernacular languages as “mischievous scribblers preaching open sedition”. He remarked that the avowed purpose of most of the vernacular newspapers was an end to the British raj.

1931- Alam Ara, India’s first talking film is released.

On this day in the year 1931, the first Indian talkie film, Alam Ara , was released marking the end of the silent era in India. Produced by “Imperial Film Co.” established by Ardeshir Irani, the film was released at Majestic Cinema, Bombay. The film was adaptation of a Parsi theatre play written by Joseph David. Alam Ara is the first Indian sound film. The movie is about the ageing king of Kamarpur, and his two rival queens, Navbahar and Dilbahar, and their rivalry when a fakir predicts that Navbahar will bear the king’s heir. Dilbahar unsuccessfully tries to seduce the army chief Adil (Vithal) and vengefully destroys his family, leaving his daughter Alam Ara (Zubeida) to be raised by nomads. Eventually, Alam Ara’s nomad friends invade the palace, expose Dilbahar’s schemes, release Adil from the dungeon and she marries the prince of the realm .

.Master Vithal and Zubeida were the lead pair. Music by Ferozshah M. Mistri and B. Irani. The film was a huge hit at the box office. Produced under the banner of “Imperial Movietone”. Camera was handled by Adi M. Irani. Directed by Ardeshir Irani Veteran actor, producer. Zubeida played the title role in the movie which also starred Master Vithal, Zillu, Sushila, Prithviraj Kapoor, Elizer, Wazeer Mohammed Khan and Jagdish Sethi.The film was inspired by Show Boat (1929), released by Universal Pictures. The 10,500–foot-long costume and fantasy drama was made in Hindi and Urdu.

BIRTHS:

1895-Gurmukh Nihal Singh was the first Governor of Rajasthan and second Chief Minister of Delhi .He was the successor of Chaudhary Brahm Prakash and assumed office in 1955 just for one year, as after that States Reorganisation Act, 1956 was passed which made Delhi a Union Territory. Thus, no one was appointed the next CM of Delhi until legislative assembly elections in Delhi were held in 1993, when Union Territory of Delhi was formally declared as National Capital Territory of Delhi by the Sixty-ninth Amendment to the Indian constitution.

1913-Sankaran Kutty Pottekkatt (14 March 1913 – 6 August 1982), popularly known as S. K. Pottekkatt, is a famous Malayalam writer from Kerala. Jnanpith Award in 1980 for the novel Oru Desathinte Katha (The Story of a Locale).

Bibliography: Novels:Naadan Premam,Vallikadevi, Oru Theruvinte Katha,Oru Desathinte Katha; Short Stories: Chandrakaantham,Manimaalika, Rajamalli,Nisshagandhi,Pulliman, Meghamala,Jalatharangam,Vijayanthi,Pournami,Padmaagam,Indraneelam,Himavahini,Prethabhoomi,Rangamandapam,Yavanikkaku, Pinnil, allipookkal, Vanakaumudhi, Kanakaambaram, Antharvahini,Ezhilampala,Theranjedutha Kathakal,Vrindaavanam, Kaattuchempakam,”Braandhan naaya” Travelogues:Nile Diary (Egypt Journey),Yathra Smaranakal (Memories of a Journey),Indonesian Diary, Soviet Diary,Cleopatrayude Naattil (In the Land of Cleopatra)

1913-S.N. Tripathi was an Indian composer turned to direction in 1957 starting with Rani Roopmati. Two of his films with Nirupa Roy and Bharat Bhushan, Rani Roopmati (1959) and Kavi Kalidas (1959).He gained popularity as an actor when he started playing the role of Hanuman in mythological and religious films like Homi Wadia’s Hanuman Pataal Vijay (1951),He was the first composer to make use of the slogan “Jai Hind” (Victory to India) in a song in films, during the end of the British Raj. The song was “Jai Hind, Jai Hind, Jai Hind, Yeh Hind Ki Kahaniyan” from the film Mansarovar (1946)

1918-K. V. Mahadevan (born Krishnankoil Venkatachalam Mahadevan 14 March 1918 – 21 June 2001) was an Indian composer, singer-songwriter, music producer, and musician known for his works in Telugu, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam cinema.The bhava, not orchestra, was his forte. Even for MGR films, that relied mostly on the entertaining aspect of cinema, the orchestration was minimum. The title song in MGR’s `Thozhilali’ for example, had just three instruments.S. P. Balasubramaniam made his debut in Tamil Cinema in the MGR starrer “Adimai Penn” that had music score by K. V. Mahadevan.K.V.Mahadevan was born in Tamil Iyer family in 1918 in Krishnancoil, Kanyakumari district. A contemporary of M. S. Viswanathan, T. K. Ramamoorthy, KVM has scored music for over 600 films, spanning four decades.His most famous compositions in Telugu were in the movies directed by K. Viswanath like Sankarabharanam, Saptapadi, Sirivennela, Chelleli Kapuram, Jeevana Jyothi, Swathi Kiranam.

Partial KV’s Telugu Hits : Adhwaita Siddhiki, Manasa Sancharare, Omkaara Naadaanusandhanam, Raagam Taanam Pallavi,Saamaja Vara Gamana,Shankaraa Naadashareeraparaa-Sankarabharanam;Cheekati Velugula,Challani babu,vayase Ooka Poolathota-Vichitra Bhandam;Chakkanayya Chandamama-Bharya Biddalu;Dorakuna Ituvanti Seva-Sankarabharanam;Em Vaana Tarumutunnadi,Iruvuru Bhamala Kougililo-Nari Nari Naduma Murari;Eegali Eenela-Sirivennela;Idi Aamani Sage Chaitraradam-Jegantalu;Kannulu Kannulatho-Sumangali;Kurise Vennello-Andala Ramudu;Malle Pandhiri Needalona-Mayadari Malligadu;Mokkajonna Thotalo-Adrustavanthulu;Paccha Gadi Koseti-Dasara Bullodu;Thalaki Neellosukuni-Mayadaari Malligadu;vandanalu-Jegantalu; Adagaka Ichhina Manase Muddu-Dagudu Mutalu; Adi Oka Challani Ratri-Oka Challani Ratri; Adigo Navalokam-Veerabhimanyu; Akesi, Pappesi, Bevvesi, Neyyesi-Abhimanyudu; Akhilandeswari..chamundeswari-Saptapadi; Aku Pacchani Chelo-Illu-illalu; Akulu, Pokalu Ivvoddu-Bharya Biddalu.

1929-Zia Mohiuddin Dagar (14 March 1929 – 28 September 1990), popularly known as Z. M. Dagar, was a North Indian (Hindustani) classical musician, one of the 19th generation of Dagar family dhrupad musicians. He was largely responsible for the revival of the rudra vina as a solo concert instrument.

1931-Prabhakar Panshikar (14 March 1931 – 13 January 2011) was an actor on Marathi stage.His Autobiography ‘Toch Me”.Some of Panshikar’s popular plays include ‘Bhatala Dili Osari’, ‘To Mi Navhech’, ‘Ithe Oshalala Mrutyu’, ‘Ashrunchi Jhali Phule’, ‘Thank You Mr Glad’ and ‘Jevha Gavtala Bhale Phutatat’.Panshikar, in a career spanning over 50 tireless years, acted in over 8,000 shows of plays in Marathi, Gujarati and Kannada languages.He was also the owner of Natyasampada, a well-known Marathi drama production organisation

1949-Farida Jalal is a veteran Indian actress who has acted in over two-hundred Bollywood films.She is best remembered for her role as Rajesh Khanna’s betrothed in the 1969 hit Aradhana and for her song ‘Bhagon Mein Bahar Hai, Kaliyon Pe Nikhar Hai.. One of her most critically acclaimed act was of Rishi Kapoor’s mentally disabled fiancee, Nikki in the film ‘Bobby’. Also, she is fondly remembered in the romantic track, “Bagon me bahar hai, kaliyon pe nikhar hai” of ‘Aradhana’, pictured on her and Rajesh Khanna. In 1991, she marked her comeback playing Bibi Gul in the film ‘Henna’

1950-Raj Senani is an eminent academician and researcher in the field of electronics engineering. Apart from teaching courses in the areas related to Analog Circuit Design, he has made significant contributions to the fields of Analog integrated circuits, Analog signal processing and Analog VLSI Circuits, in the course of his research work.

1953-Arun Krushnaji Kamble was a Marathi writer and Dalit activist.

1965-Aamir Khan is an Indian film actor, director, and producer. Khan first appeared on screen as a child actor in his uncle Nasir Hussain’s film Yaadon Ki Baaraat (1973). Some of Notable films : Raakh (1989),Dil (1990),Raja Hindustani (1996),Sarfarosh (1999), Earth (1998), Lagaan (2001),Fanaa and Rang De Basanti (2006),Taare Zameen Par,Ghajini (2008), 3 Idiots (2009), Dhoom 3 (2013), PK (2014). He has created and hosted the television talk show Satyamev Jayate, through which he highlights sensitive social issues in India.

1967-Vijay Yadav is a former cricketer. A wicket keeper and an aggressive lower-order batsman.

1972-Irom Chanu Sharmila is a civil rights activist, political activist, and poet from the Indian state of Manipur. On 2 November 2000, she began a hunger strike which she ended on 9 August 2016, after 16 years of fasting. Having refused food and water for more than 500 weeks, she has been called “the world’s longest hunger striker.on 2 November 2000, in Malom, a town in the Imphal Valley of Manipur, ten civilians were shot and killed while waiting at a bus stop. The incident, known as the “Malom Massacre.Her primary demand to the Indian government has been the repeal of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA).

1973-Rohit Shetty is an Indian film director and cinematographer. His work as a filmmaker include the films Golmaal, Golmaal Returns, Golmaal 3, Singham, Bol Bachchan, Singham Returns, Chennai Express and Dilwale.

1973-Prahlad Acharya is a prominent magician, illusionist, escapologist,shadow play artist,storyteller and stunt performer from Udupi, Karnataka.Prahlad has performed Speaking Shadows – his amazing hand-shadow act around the globe, including Germany, Australia, Singapore, the Middle East, and of course, India. He is acknowledged to be among the very best in the world in what he does.Speaking Shadows is a mesmerising world of hand shadows weaving highly entertaining and interactive tales from the animal and human world; where hands artistically encounter a source of light, to project on a large screen. A truly magical world ‘where shadows speak’ and come to life.Prahlad’s most memorable performance was at the Swedish Embassy in March 2002, where he performed the legendary rope trick. According to him, the rope trick can be performed only outdoors, in open spaces. He demonstrates a simple rope trick, where he places a coil of rope on the ground and plays the been like a snake charmer. Suddenly the rope becomes stiff and stands upright, and he climbs up the rope.

1974-Sadhana Sargam is a playback singer of Indian cinema with a career spanning over three decades. National Film Award for Best Female Playback Singer in 2002 for the song “Pattu Solli”from the film “Azhagi”. Sadhana recorded her career first song for their Gujarati film Kanku Pagli. The first Hindi song she sang for them was Door Nahin Rehna (Rustom).She earned fame after Rajesh Roshan gave her all the female songs of brother Rakesh Roshan Khudgarz (1987). Followed Khoon Bhari Maang, Aasman Se Ooncha, Jurm, Kishan Kanhaiya and others under Rajesh Roshan, Tridev, Vishwatma, Tere Mere Sapne, Aar Ya Paar and Gupt under Viju Shah, Aankhen (Angna Mein Baba under Bappi Lahiri, Saudagar (Imli Ka Boota / Laxmikant-Pyarelal) and Pehla Nasha (Jo Jeeta Wahi Sikandar / Jatin-Lalit) and many other songs under Anand-Milind, Nadeem-Shravan and Anu Malik.

Part of Notable Songs: Saat Saheliya Khadi Khadi,Neele Neele Ambar Par,Jiya Nahi Laage,Har Kisi Ko Nahi Milta,Gajar Ne Kiya Hai Ishara,Mere Humsafar,Duniya Wale Bhi Kya Yaad Karenge,

Tamil Hits: Vennilave Vennilave, Chudithar Aninthu, Kadhal Vanthathum, Anbae Sugama,Poo Vasam -I,Kaiyil Deepam,Anbae Anbae,Maankuttiye,Katril Varum Geethame,Kaatril,Kandum Kanaamal,

Foreign Celebrities Who Born in India:

1894-Lieutenant-Colonel William Earle Molesworth MC* (14 March 1894 – 22 October 1955) was a British First World War flying ace credited with eighteen aerial victories.born in Andaman Islands, India.

Deaths:

1883 – Karl Marx 5 May 1818 – 14 March 1883) was a German-born scientist, philosopher, economist, sociologist, journalist, and revolutionary socialist.

1963-Jainarain Vyas(1899–1963) freedom fighter,3rd was a chief minister of the Indian state of Rajasthan. On March 3, 1948 he became the Prime Minister of Jodhpur State.

1998-Krishna Kondke (August 8, 1932 – March 14, 1998), popularly known as Dada Kondke, was a Marathi actor and film producer.Dada Kondke was entered in the Guinness Book of World Records for the highest number of films (nine) that achieved silver jubilee (running for 25 consecutive weeks).

2003-Suresh Bhat April 15, 1932 – March 14, 2003) was a noted Marathi poet.He was known as Ghazal Samrat (Emperor of ghazals) for his exposition of the ghazal form of poetry.poetry collections:Roopgandha,Ranga maazhaa vegalaa, Elgaar, Zanjhaavaat, Saptaranga, Rasvanticha Mujara

2010-Govind Vinayak Karandikar (August 23, 1918 – March 14, 2010), better known as Vinda Karandikar, was a well-known Marathi poet, writer, literary critic, and translator.Karandikar’s poetic works include Svedganga (River of Sweat) (1949), Mrudgandha (1954), Dhrupad (1959), Jatak (1968), and Virupika (1980). Two anthologies of his selected poems, Sanhita (1975) and Adimaya (1990) were also published. His poetic works for children include Ranicha Bag (1961), Sashyache Kan (1963), and Pari Ga Pari (1965)

Idiom of the Day:

Greek to me

Meaning:

Greek is the adjective form for the country Greece.

It’s (all) Greek to me is used to describe something that is very confusing or not understandable.

Usage:

I’ve tried reading the instructions but it’s all Greek to me.
